bortentious Hopkins influence," and turned down the
University's request for the annexation of Wyman Park.

Dr. Milton S. Eisenhower has
announced that he will resign
his post as President of the Johns
Hopkins University in order to
campaign for nomination as
GOP candidate for Vice-President of the United States.

late yesterday, Dr. Eisenhower
and U.S. Vice-President Richard
M. Nixon officially announced

Orlinsky Changes N-L's Handmaker
Party Allegiance, Parries Vs. Fate;
Supports Nixon Hits Dog Instead
Young
Democrats'
leader
'Wally Orlinsky announced this
week that he has switched
allegiances and will back Nixon
for President.
Orlinsky stated that he is now
chairman of the Baltimore "Students for Nixon" campaign society and will actively work for
election of the Republican candidate next fall.
Richard M. Nixon, currently
Vice-President of the United
states, will be unopposed for the
Republican presidential nomination "unless I decide to run,"
Wally chortled. It is believed that
be was joking.
The Hopkins political figure
(Orlinsky) also announced that
he has arranged for a campaign
speech at Hopkins on the day
before presidential election day
next fall. Mr. Nixon will be featured speaker. Dr. Milton S.
Eisenhower,
Vide - Presidential
candidate, will also speak.

News-Letter Editor Stan Handmaker was saved from imminent
death in a motor scooter crash
last Tuesday night by his crash
helmet.
Returning from a class at the
medical school, Handmaker was
thrown from his scooter after he
hit a dog on North Broadway.
The Editor was travelling at
about forty miles-an-hour when
the dog ran into the street.
Handmaker slowed down to avoid
it, but when the canine also
slowed down, Handmaker increased his speed. It was then
that the dog ran in front of the
speeding scooter.
Though the scooter wasn't
damaged Handmaker suffered a
number of injuries, mostly bruises
and lacerations. The Editor is
thanking God however for his
white crash helmet that was until now an object of ridicule on
campus. His helmet now sports
a four-inch dent as evidence of
the crash.

The spring rioting season began early last week with the
first brutal beating of a Johns
Hopkins sophomore here on the
University campus.
Marvin H. Symple, Class of
'62, is now in Union Memorial
Hospital receiving treatment for
injuries received when he was
beaten up and then thrown from
a moving car last Monday night,
presumably by students from the
University of Maryland.
Symple was apparently cross-

Now chained in the subbasement of Merganthaler Hall, the
mutant plant life is undergoing
intensive study. Already it has
shown many puzzling characteristics.

The creature stands fifteen
feet high and is completely
covered with green foliage. At
its apical end is located one giant
red eye spot and something that,
is similar to mouth through
which it ingests its food.
The most mysterious thing
about the being is that it shows
both plant and animal-like
characteristics, Dr. William D.
MacAlleoy, chairman of the
Biology department, explained
that it resembles a mammal in
its "amazing motility and its
metabolism of preformed organic
material. But yet it closely resembles a plant by being able to
create complex organic foods
through photosynthesis."
Two Theories
There have been two conflicting theories about its creation
but neither will be verified due
to the disappearance of Dr.
Ja,gendorf and the destruction
of his notes. It is known that
the "Monster Plant" was origi-

Dr. G. Wilson Shaffer has announced his resignation as Dean
of the Homewood Schools and
acceptapce of a coaching position with the Baltimore Orioles
baseball club. Shaffer was formerly an outfielder for the Dallas
Tigers, a semi-professional team.

Orlinsky Changes N-L's Handmaker
Party Allegiance, Parries Vs. Fate;
Supports Nixon Hits Dog Instead
Young
Democrats'
leader
'Wally Orlinsky announced this
week that he has switched
allegiances and will back Nixon
for President.
Orlinsky stated that he is now
chairman of the Baltimore "Students for Nixon" campaign society and will actively work for
election of the Republican candidate next fall.
Richard M. Nixon, currently
Vice-President of the United
states, will be unopposed for the
Republican presidential nomination "unless I decide to run,"
Wally chortled. It is believed that
be was joking.
The Hopkins political figure
(Orlinsky) also announced that
he has arranged for a campaign
speech at Hopkins on the day
before presidential election day
next fall. Mr. Nixon will be featured speaker. Dr. Milton S.
Eisenhower,
Vide - Presidential
candidate, will also speak.

News-Letter Editor Stan Handmaker was saved from imminent
death in a motor scooter crash
last Tuesday night by his crash
helmet.
Returning from a class at the
medical school, Handmaker was
thrown from his scooter after he
hit a dog on North Broadway.
The Editor was travelling at
about forty miles-an-hour when
the dog ran into the street.
Handmaker slowed down to avoid
it, but when the canine also
slowed down, Handmaker increased his speed. It was then
that the dog ran in front of the
speeding scooter.
Though the scooter wasn't
damaged Handmaker suffered a
number of injuries, mostly bruises
and lacerations. The Editor is
thanking God however for his
white crash helmet that was until now an object of ridicule on
campus. His helmet now sports
a four-inch dent as evidence of
the crash.

The spring rioting season began early last week with the
first brutal beating of a Johns
Hopkins sophomore here on the
University campus.
Marvin H. Symple, Class of
'62, is now in Union Memorial
Hospital receiving treatment for
injuries received when he was
beaten up and then thrown from
a moving car last Monday night,
presumably by students from the
University of Maryland.
Symple was apparently cross-

Now chained in the subbasement of Merganthaler Hall, the
mutant plant life is undergoing
intensive study. Already it has
shown many puzzling characteristics.

The creature stands fifteen
feet high and is completely
covered with green foliage. At
its apical end is located one giant
red eye spot and something that,
is similar to mouth through
which it ingests its food.
The most mysterious thing
about the being is that it shows
both plant and animal-like
characteristics, Dr. William D.
MacAlleoy, chairman of the
Biology department, explained
that it resembles a mammal in
its "amazing motility and its
metabolism of preformed organic
material. But yet it closely resembles a plant by being able to
create complex organic foods
through photosynthesis."
Two Theories
There have been two conflicting theories about its creation
but neither will be verified due
to the disappearance of Dr.
Ja,gendorf and the destruction
of his notes. It is known that
the "Monster Plant" was origi-
